children.label: shr.actor
children.description: The SHR Actor domain contains definitions for people and organizations that are involved with the person of record, in some capacity.

children.label: AdministrativeGender
children.description: Gender is used to refer to administrative sex rather than biological sex and therefore should easily be classified into female and male.  This attribute does not include terms related to clinical gender.

children.label: Affiliation
children.description: Membership, association, or connection to an organization

children.label: AgeAtDeath
children.description: The age, age range, or age group when the cessation of life happens.

children.label: Anonymized
children.description: Flag indicating if personally identifiable information has been withheld

children.label: DateOfBirth
children.description: A date of birth or approximate year or period (year or date range), if estimated.

children.label: DateOfDeath
children.description: The calendar date of subject's death.

children.label: Deceased
children.description: Date or time of death, or boolean indicates the person is deceased.

children.label: DidOrDidNotParticipate
children.description: Whether the mentioned person or organization participated in the described activity

children.label: DoesProviderRelationshipExist
children.description: Whether the person of record has a provider relationship of the type mentioned

children.label: EmergencyContact
children.description: A personal contact specifically designated to be used for emergencies.

children.label: Ethnicity
children.description: Indicator of Hispanic or Latino origin.

children.label: EthnicityDetail
children.description: Additional description of ethnicity

children.label: FamilialRelationship
children.description: The relationship of this person to the person of record, if the person is in the same (extended) family

children.label: FictionalPerson
children.description: Flag indicating if this record represents a fictional (synthetic, not real) person

children.label: HealthcareRole
children.description: A type of service provided to the subject

children.label: LanguageQualifier
children.description: Additional information about a person's use of language

children.label: LanguageUsed
children.description: Language used for communication by a human, either the subject of record, parent, or other involved person.

children.label: MedicalSpecialty
children.description: A branch of medicine practiced by the provider

children.label: NationalProviderIdentifier
children.description: A unique 10-digit number to allow providers to identify themselves in a standard way throughout their industry

children.label: NoPrimaryCareProvider
children.description: The medical professional responsible for first-line care of an individual.

children.label: Organization
children.description: A social or legal structure formed by human beings

children.label: OrganizationAlias
children.description: A list of alternate names that the organization is known as, or was known as in the past.

children.label: OrganizationIdentifyingCode
children.description: A code identifying a specific organization. The NPI should be provided, if available. Other business identifiers, such employer tax ID, or MVX code for vaccine manufacturers, should also be provided.

children.label: OrganizationName
children.description: The name of the organization.

children.label: OrganizationType
children.description: A classification of the organization in terms of its major role in healthcare

children.label: ParticipationStatement
children.description: A statement about an actor who did or did not perform a certain task or activity. Unlike a HealthcareInvolvement which continues over period of time, the performer is associated with doing or not doing a specific task, such admitting a patient, performing a procedure, or taking a measurement

children.label: ParticipationType
children.description: The detail of how the performer engaged in the task, for example, as the attending physician, surgical assistant, etc.

children.label: Person
children.description: A person, particularly those relevant to the health or social situation of the subject (including the person of record).

children.label: Practitioner
children.description: A person who practices a healing art.

children.label: PrimaryCareProvider
children.description: The medical professional responsible for first-line care of an individual.

children.label: Provider
children.description: A person or organization who provides a service to the person of record. This includes healthcare and relevant non-healthcare services, and personal services such as transportation.

children.label: ProviderRelationshipStatement
children.description: Statement about a person or organization providing services to the person of record at a particular time or over a given time interval. Can also be used to state that a provider relationship does not exist, e.g., patient does not have a primary care provider

children.label: Race
children.description: Subjective association of a person with a named category of humans sharing common history, traits, place of family origin, nationality, tribe, or other inherited background.

children.label: RaceDetail
children.description: Additional description of race or heritage.

children.label: SpokenLanguageProficiency
children.description: Accuracy and fluency in spoken communication in a language.

children.label: WrittenProficiency
children.description: Accuracy and fluency of reading and writing in a language.

children.label: shr.adverse
children.description: The SHR Adverse domain contains definitions for describing adverse events and adverse reactions.

children.label: AdverseReactionStatement
children.description: A statement about a possible adverse reaction attributed to exposure to a substance. It is not necessarily associated with a previously-recorded SubstanceRisk. This Entry could be used to record an adverse reaction to an immunization or food.

children.label: AttributionCertainty

concepts.label: Adverse Event Attribution to Product or Procedure (http://uts.nlm.nih.gov/metathesaurus:C1510821)
concepts.display: Adverse Event Attribution to Product or Procedure

children.description: A specific identifiable level (defined qualitatively or quantitatively) of probability of adverse event being caused or associated with the product or procedure administration to a patient.

children.label: shr.allergy
children.description: The SHR Allergy domain contains definitions for statements dealing with substance-related risks, including allergies and intolerances.

children.label: AdverseReactionRiskStatement
children.description: A statement pertaining to an individual's allergies and intolerances to substances or classes of substances. Can be used to record that a substance does not pose an elevated risk to the subject (ElevatedRiskExists = false)

children.label: AdverseReactionType
children.description: Identification of the underlying physiological mechanism for a Reaction Risk.

children.label: AllergenIrritant
children.description: A material, mixture, class or category of substance, including drugs, foods, environmental agents, etc. that may be implicated as sources of intolerances and allergies.

children.label: DrugAllergyStatement
children.description: An immune or biochemical adverse reaction to a medication

children.label: ElevatedRiskExists
children.description: Whether the substance poses an elevated risk to the subject

children.label: FoodAllergyStatement
children.description: An immune or biochemical adverse reaction to a food substance

children.label: MostRecentOccurrence
children.description: The time of the last or latest of a series of events

children.label: NoKnownAllergy
children.description: The subject has no known allergies to drugs, foods, biologics, or environmental factors

children.label: NoKnownDrugAllergy
children.description: The subject has no known allergies to any medications.

children.label: NoKnownEnvironmentalAllergy
children.description: The subject has no known allergies to any environmental factors.

children.label: NoKnownFoodAllergy
children.description: The subject has no known allergies to any foods

children.label: SubstanceCategory
children.description: Categorization of the risk substance as a food, drug, or environmental agent. Difficult-to-classify substances can be leave this empty or choose the most typical category.

children.label: Verified
children.description: Whether an assessment has been confirmed by testing or observation.

children.label: shr.base
children.description: The SHR Base domain contains definitions for elements that are widely shared in SHR, including the base Entry and associated metadata.

children.label: AccessTime
children.description: Point in time when data was accessed

children.label: AssociatedEncounter
children.description: The encounter or episode of care that led to creation of this entry

children.label: Author
children.description: The person or organization who created the entry and is responsible for (and may certify) its content.

children.label: DateEntered
children.description: The point in time when the information was recorded in the system of record.

children.label: DateUpdated
children.description: A date that the entry was changed

children.label: Entry
children.description: An item inserted in an electronic record

children.label: EntryID
children.description: A unique, persistent, permanent identifier for an entry in a health record

children.label: EntryType
children.description: The SHR data element identifier, for example, http://standardhealthrecord.org/allergy/SubstanceRisk. The EntryType array includes the entire 'based on' hierarchy to enable searching for classes of things, for example, searching for all vital signs, or all types of behavioral observations.

children.label: ExternalHealthRecord
children.description: A health record used to help populate the current health record

children.label: FocalSubject
children.description: The person or thing that this entry refers to, usually the Person of Record. However, not all entries refer to the Person of Record. The entry could refer to a fetus, care giver, or relative (living or dead)

children.label: HealthRecordID
children.description: Identifier for a health record. Interpreted in the context of the providing organization.

children.label: Informant
children.description: The person or entity that provided the information in the entry, as distinct from the actor creating the entry, e.g. the subject (patient), medical professional, family member, device or software program.

children.label: Language
children.description: A human language, spoken or written

children.label: Meta
children.description: Contains elements common to all entries, describing the identification, timing, attribution, and other properties of the entry.

children.label: MissingValueReason
children.description: The reason a required element, complex type, or primitive value is missing. Missing value reason can be substituted for any value.

children.label: ShrID
children.description: A unique, persistent identifier for the Standard Health Record to which this entry belongs.

children.label: SubjectIsThirdParty
children.description: A flag indicating this entry concerns someone other than the Person of Record

children.label: shr.behavior
children.description: The SHR Behavior domain contains data definitions related to how the person of record acts, feels, or responds to situations.

children.label: AlcoholBingeingFrequency
children.description: How often have you had 6 or more Units if female, or 8 or more if male, on a single occasion in the last year?

children.label: AlcoholUse
children.description: The history of the subject's use of alcohol

children.label: DietAndNutrition
children.description: The usual food and drink consumed by an individual

children.label: DoesSubjectUseSubstance
children.description: Records if the subject uses a particular substance or class of substances

children.label: ExerciseHoursPerWeek
children.description: Hours of moderate or vigorous activity per week

children.label: HoursSleepPerNight
children.description: Typical hours spent sleeping per night

children.label: IntravenousDrugUseStatement
children.description: Records whether the subject injects recreational drugs

children.label: PhysicalActivityLevel
children.description: The amount of exercise or other physical activity compared to others of the same age.  See BMC Medical Research Methodology 2012 12:20 1471-2288

children.label: PhysicalActivityLimitation
children.description: Anything that limits physical activity, including health factors, logistical, monetary, or social restrictions

children.label: ReligiousCongregation
children.description: A group of place of religious practice

children.label: ReligiousPractice
children.description: The religion practiced by the focal subject

children.label: ReligiousPracticeStatus
children.description: The extent to which the religious practice is actively followed

children.label: ReligiousRestriction
children.description: Any restriction on that derives from religion and may impact medical treatment, other than dietary (handled elsewhere)

children.label: SleepQuality
children.description: Self-reported sleep quality

children.label: SleepQualityReason
children.description: Reason for poor sleep quality

children.label: SmokingStatus
children.description: Records the subject's use of tobacco

children.label: SpecialDietFollowed
children.description: A type of nutritional plan followed by the subject

children.label: SubstanceAbuseTreatment
children.description: The treatment program used to address a substance abuse problem

children.label: SubstanceAbuseTreatmentType
children.description: The type of program or treatment used to address a substance abuse problem

children.label: SubstanceUseStatement
children.description: Assertion concerning the past or current use of a substance (alcohol, recreational drugs, illegal drugs, or abuse of prescription medication) that could negatively impact the subject's health.

children.label: TroubleFallingAsleep
children.description: How often the subject has trouble falling asleep

children.label: TroubleStayingAsleep
children.description: How often the subject has trouble staying asleep

children.label: ViolentBehaviorRisk
children.description: Risk or danger posed by the focal subject to others and/or his or herself due to violent behavior

children.label: ViolentRiskToOthers
children.description: Risk or danger posed by the focal subject to others

children.label: ViolentRiskToSelf
children.description: Risk or danger posed by the focal subject to his or herself

children.label: WakeFeelingRested
children.description: How often the subject feels rested when they wake up

children.label: shr.core
children.description: The SHR Core domain contains definitions for a variety of general-purpose elements that are used widely in SHR. These include definitions for coding, expressions of time, quantities, addresses, names, and more.

children.label: Address
children.description: An address expressed using postal conventions (as opposed to GPS or other location definition formats). This data type may be used to convey addresses for use in delivering mail as well as for visiting locations and which might not be valid for mail delivery. There are a variety of postal address formats defined around the world. (Source: HL7 FHIR)

children.label: AddressLine
children.description: Part of an address that contains the house number, apartment number, street name, street direction, P.O. Box number, delivery hints, and similar address information. (Source: HL7 FHIR)

children.label: Age
children.description: How long something has existed (quantitative).

children.label: AgeGroup
children.description: Subgroups of populations based on age.

children.label: AgeRange
children.description: A range of ages, quantitative

children.label: AgeRangeLowerBound
children.description: The lower end of an age range

children.label: AgeRangeUpperBound
children.description: The upper end of an age range

children.label: Altitude
children.description: Height above sea level or above the earth's surface. Measured with with WGS84 datum.

children.label: BodyPosition
children.description: The position or physical attitude of the body.

children.label: BodySite
children.description: Location on or in the body

children.label: BoundingType
children.description: Indicates the actual value is lt (<), lte (<=), gt (>), or gte (>=) the given value

children.label: City
children.description: The name of a city, town, village or other community or delivery center. (Source: HL7 FHIR)

children.label: CodeableConcept
children.description: A set of codes drawn from different coding systems, representing the same concept

children.label: CodeDescriptor
children.description: A description of the purpose or origin of the code that assists in the interpretation of the code.

children.label: Coding
children.description: Coding of a concept, drawn from a controlled vocabulary. Includes the vocabulary and version, if applicable. May include a display text, and a descriptor expressing the intended interpretation of the code

children.label: Comment
children.description: A critical or explanatory note written to discuss, support, explain changes to, or dispute information.

children.label: Count
children.description: The number of non-null items in a referenced set of items or values

children.label: Country
children.description: Country - a nation as commonly understood or generally accepted, expressed in ISO 3166 Alpha-2 (2-letter) codes

children.label: County
children.description: The name of the administrative area at a level below that of a state but above that of a city or town. Outside the US, a district or the equivalent. (Source: HL7 FHIR)

children.label: Denominator
children.description: The divisor of a fraction.

children.label: Description
children.description: An account, representation, statement, or explanation of something.

children.label: Details
children.description: Particulars considered individually and in relation to a whole.

children.label: DidOrDidNotOccur
children.description: Whether an event, such as an adverse reaction, occurred or not.

children.label: Directionality
children.description: Anatomical location or specimen further detailing directionality

children.label: DisplayText
children.description: A string meant for reading by a person, usually accompanying a code.

children.label: DollarAmount
children.description: An amount of money expressed in US dollars

children.label: Duration
children.description: The length of time that something continues

children.label: EffectiveDate
children.description: The date when something is to take effect

children.label: EffectiveTimePeriod
children.description: The date and time span for which something is active, valid, or in force.

children.label: ExclusiveBound
children.description: Whether a bound (upper or lower) is considered to be exclusive. If not given, the bounds are considered inclusive, so the range 10 to 20 would include 10 and 20.

children.label: Explanation
children.description: A set of statements describing a group of facts that clarifies the cause, context and/or consequence of those facts.

children.label: FamilyName
children.description: The portion of a person's name that reflects the genealogy of the person. In western cultures, this is the 'last' name. In eastern cultures, the family name appears before the person's given name(s). In some cultures (e.g. Eritrea) the family name of a son is the first name of his father. (Source: HL7 V3)

children.label: Frequency
children.description: How many occurrences of an event per unit of time

children.label: GeneralizedAge
children.description: Qualitative or quantitative, exact or inexact description of age

children.label: GeneralizedDateTime
children.description: A point in time, specified qualitatively or quantitatively

children.label: GeneralizedDuration
children.description: The duration of an event, qualitatively or quantitatively

children.label: GeneralizedFrequency
children.description: The frequency of an event, qualitatively or quantitatively

children.label: GeneralizedLikelihood
children.description: Quantitative or qualitative measure of likelihood

children.label: GeneralizedTemporalContext
children.description: A generalized indicator of a dateTime or an age when an event happened.

children.label: GeopoliticalLocation
children.description: The countries of the world and major geopolitical subregions, such as US states

children.label: GestationalAge
children.description: The age of the embryo or fetus. This may be assessed by medical history, physical examination, early immunologic pregnancy tests, radiography, ultrasonography, and amniotic fluid analysis.

children.label: GestationalTemporalContext
children.description: A named gestational time period, or a gestational age

children.label: GestationalTimePeriod
children.description: A time relative to a pregnancy or childbirth event

children.label: GivenName
children.description: A set of names given to a person at birth, but not including the family name. In western cultures, this property would contain the 'first' and 'middle' names. Note that in some cultures, the given name is placed after the family name. Note also that this property contains multiple elements, so it can handle those situations where a person has more than one 'middle' name. (Source: HL7 V3)

children.label: HumanName
children.description: A name used by a human being, written as it would be typically expressed. May include a breakdown of the various elements of the name (family name, given name, etc.)

children.label: HumanNamePrefix
children.description: Contains a set of honorific terms that typically appear before a person's name, for example Mr., Mrs., Dr., etc. Prefixes have a strong association to the immediately following name part. (Source: HL7 V3)

children.label: HumanNameSuffix
children.description: Part of the name that is acquired as a title due to academic, legal, employment or nobility status, etc. and that appears at the end of the name.

children.label: HumanNameUse
children.description: A qualifier specifying how a human name is used by a person, such as a legal name, alias, or nickname.

children.label: Laterality
children.description: Anatomical location or specimen further detailing the side(s) of interest.

children.label: Latitude
children.description: The angular distance north or south between an imaginary line around a heavenly body parallel to its equator and the equator itself. Measured with with WGS84 datum.

children.label: Likelihood
children.description: A measure of the expectation of the occurrence of a particular event.

children.label: Location
children.description: A position, site, or point in space where something can be found.

children.label: Longitude
children.description: An imaginary great circle on the surface of a heavenly body passing through the poles at right angles to the equator. Measured with with WGS84 datum.

children.label: Numerator
children.description: The dividend of a fraction.

children.label: OccurrenceTime
children.description: The point in time or span of time in which something happens.

children.label: Percentage
children.description: A percentage value, 0 to 100

children.label: PeriodOfUse
children.description: A period of time when a device, medication, or other therapy is used.

children.label: PortionTotality
children.description: Qualifier for anatomical location or specimen further detailing the portion or totality, which means arrangement of, or apportioning of an entity

children.label: PostalCode
children.description: A postal code designating a region defined by the postal service.

children.label: Priority
children.description: An ordinal numbered priority where 1=highest priority, 2=second highest priority, etc

children.label: QualitativeDateTime
children.description: A point in time, described qualitatively

children.label: QualitativeDuration
children.description: The duration of an action or event, described qualitatively

children.label: QualitativeFrequency
children.description: The frequency of an event, described qualitatively

children.label: QualitativeLikelihood
children.description: A qualitative (subjective) likelihood

children.label: Quantity
children.description: A quantity with Units

children.label: Ratio
children.description: A unit of measurement for the quotient of the amount of one entity to another.

children.label: Reason
children.description: The justification for an action, conclusion, opinion, etc.

children.label: SemiquantDuration
children.description: The duration of an event, described semi-quantitatively

children.label: SemiquantFrequency
children.description: The frequency of an event, described semi-quantitatively

children.label: Setting
children.description: Description of the place or type of surroundings where something is positioned or where an event takes place.

children.label: State
children.description: Sub-unit of a country with limited sovereignty in a federally organized country. A code may be used if codes are in common use (i.e. US 2 letter state codes). (Source: HL7 FHIR)

children.label: Statistic
children.description: A quantity that represents a statistic, e.g. maximum, minimum, mean, median, etc.

children.label: StatisticType
children.description: The type of statistic that is represented by the value

children.label: Substance
children.description: Any matter of defined composition that has discrete existence, whose origin may be biological, mineral or chemical.

children.label: Summary
children.description: A shortened version of an item of information, containing only the main points.

children.label: TimePeriod
children.description: A period of time defined by a start and end time, date, or year

children.label: TimePeriodEnd
children.description: The time at which something is to end or did end.

children.label: TimePeriodStart
children.description: The time at which something is to take effect, start, or did start.

children.label: UnitedStatesAddress
children.description: An address for a place in the USA, conforming to US mail postal conventions. (Source: HL7 FHIR)

children.label: UnitedStatesState
children.description: A state or territory in the USA expressed by 2-letter US Postal code

children.label: Units
children.description: Code for the unit of measure of the quantity

children.label: UpperOrLowerBound
children.description: A measured or measurable amount with units that is known to be bounded by  the quantity represents

children.label: Version
children.description: A string identifying the particular of form of something (such as a code system or software product) that is different in some way from another form of the same thing.

children.label: Vocabulary
children.description: A formal terminology system

children.label: VocabularyVersion
children.description: The version of the vocabulary being used, if applicable

children.label: shr.demographics
children.description: The SHR Demographics domain contains definitions that describe basic characteristics of the person of record, such as name, address, and date of birth. Elements in the demographics domains are used for unique identification and patient matching.

children.label: AddressUse
children.description: Describes how the address is used, in particular, as a dwelling (primary, secondary, temporary), a former address, mailing address, etc.

children.label: AddressUsed
children.description: An address used by for dwelling, work, or other purposes. May be a physical location or an address used only for deliveries, such as a PO box.

children.label: BirthSex
children.description: Administrative sex assigned at birth and recorded on birth certificate.

children.label: CountryOfIssue
children.description: A country acting as an assuing authority for a document

children.label: DriversLicenseNumber
children.description: Identifying information from a drivers license

children.label: FathersName
children.description: The name of the father as it was or likely to have been recorded on the birth certificate of the subject; most likely the name of the father at the time of birth of the subject.

children.label: HealthInsurance
children.description: Health insurance coverage available (even if not used for payment for a given encounter)

children.label: HomeTelephoneNumber
children.description: A telephone number associated with a person's residence

children.label: InsuranceMemberId
children.description: Patient identifier at a healthcare provider, insurer, or other related organization.

children.label: MaritalStatus
children.description: The most recent marital status of a person.

children.label: MedicalInterpreterNeeded
children.description: Whether the subject requires an interpreter to communicate with an English-speaking provider

children.label: MothersMaidenName
children.description: The name of the mother as it was or likely to have been recorded on the birth certificate of the subject. This is most likely the name prior to marriage of the mother (aka the maiden name).

children.label: MultipleBirth
children.description: Indication if the person was part of a multiple birth event

children.label: MultipleBirthOrder
children.description: Order of birth of the person in multiple birth event (if part of multiple birth)

children.label: PassportNumber
children.description: Indicator of citizenship and identity

children.label: PersonOfRecord
children.description: Extended demographic information about the subject of this SHR

children.label: PlaceOfBirth
children.description: The location of a birth event. There may be multiple entries, but a person has only one place of birth.

children.label: SocialSecurityNumber
children.description: A US social security number (SSN)

children.label: StateOfIssue
children.description: Issuing authority for a drivers license

children.label: Telecom
children.description: An electronic means of contacting an organization or individual

children.label: TelecomNumberOrAddress
children.description: A user name or other identifier on a telecommunication network, such as a telephone number (including country code and extension, if necessary), email address, or SkypeID

children.label: TelecomQualifier
children.description: Provides more information about the type and uses of the telecom address

children.label: TelecomType
children.description: The type or channel of the communication, such as email or telephone. If an messaging app, such as Skype, name the application using string

children.label: TelephoneNumber
children.description: A sequence of decimal digits (0-9) that is used for identifying a destination telephone line or other device in a telephone network.

children.label: WorkTelephoneNumber
children.description: A telephone number associated with a person's residence

children.label: shr.device
children.description: The SHR Device domain contains definitions relating to devices used to treat the person of record, either in measurements and observations, durable medical equipment used by the patient, and device implants.

children.label: Device
children.description: A durable physical device used in diagnosis or treatment.

children.label: DeviceType
children.description: The type of device, for example, a CPAP machine.

children.label: DeviceUseStatement
children.description: A statement pertaining to the use of a device by a subject. May document the use of a device, or that the subject does not use a particular type of device.

children.label: Implanted
children.description: Whether this device is implanted in the body

children.label: InventoryNumber
children.description: An identifying number for a device, assigned by the organization using the device.

children.label: VendorModelNumber
children.description: The model number of the device, assigned by the manufacturer or vendor.

children.label: VendorSerialNumber
children.description: The unique serial number of the device, assigned by the manufacturer or vendor.

children.label: shr.encounter
children.description: The SHR Encounter domain contains definitions that capture interactions between the person of record and healthcare providers, including inpatient, ambulatory care, and telecare.

children.label: DidEncounterHappen
children.description: Whether the encounter actually occurred. Can be used to record missed appointments.

children.label: EncounterStatement
children.description: A statement about a planned or actual interaction between a patient and healthcare provider(s) for the purpose of providing healthcare service(s) or assessing the health status of a patient.

children.label: EpisodeOfCareCompletion
children.description: Denotes how and why an episode of care ended.

children.label: Facility
children.description: Services and space and equipment provided for a particular purpose; a building or place that provides a particular service or is used for a particular industry. Could be a clinical site, community site, or a mobile facility

children.label: FacilityName
children.description: The DBA (doing business as) or most commonly-used name for a facility

children.label: FacilityType
children.description: The type of function performed at the facility.

children.label: ManagingOrganization
children.description: The organization that manages the operation of an activity, facility, or service provision

children.label: MobileFacility
children.description: A facility that moves from place to place, such as Meals-On-Wheels

children.label: PaymentSource
children.description: The source of payment for the current encounter

children.label: ReasonEncounterDidNotHappen
children.description: If encounter did not occur, describes the reason it did not, e.g., patient hospitalized, cancelled, lost touch with patient, withdrew from trial, etc.

children.label: ReferralDate
children.description: The date when the provider received a referral for service. A referral includes an oral, written, FAXed or electronic request for services made by the client or on the client's behalf.

children.label: ReferralSourceType
children.description: The type of person or entity that instigated the encounter.

children.label: TreatmentCooperation
children.description: The reason for the subject participating in treatment

children.label: shr.environment
children.description: The SHR Environment domain contains definitions related to surroundings experienced by the person of record, including both the physical and sociological environments.

children.label: AnimalExposureStatement
children.description: The type of animals or pets the subject is exposed to

children.label: AnnualIncome
children.description: The amount of earnings made by a family unit in one year, estimated or self-reported

children.label: CanAffordChildCare
children.description: How often can the subject afford child care?

children.label: CanAffordClothing
children.description: How often can the subject afford clothing?

children.label: CanAffordDentalCare
children.description: How often can the subject afford dental care?

children.label: CanAffordFood
children.description: How often can the subject afford food?

children.label: CanAffordHousing
children.description: How often can the subject afford housing?

children.label: CanAffordMedication
children.description: How often can the subject afford medications?

children.label: CanAffordTransportation
children.description: How often can the subject afford transportation?

children.label: CanAffordUtilities
children.description: How often can the subject afford utilities?

children.label: Coinhabitant
children.description: A person living with the subject

children.label: DomesticViolenceAggressor
children.description: How often the subject is a domestic abuser

children.label: DomesticViolenceTarget
children.description: How often the subject is or was a target of domestic violence

children.label: FinancialResources
children.description: Measures of the ability of the subject to obtain and pay for the necessities of life

children.label: HomeEnvironmentRisk
children.description: A risk experienced in the home environment

children.label: HouseholdComposition
children.description: Information about the makeup of the household of the subject

children.label: HouseholdSize
children.description: The number of people living together with mutual financial dependency. Besides the subject, the household size may include spouse or partner, dependent children including adopted and foster children, dependent parents, dependent siblings and other relatives, but not roommates, ex-spouses, non-dependent children, and unborn children. If the subject lives alone, the household size is 1.

children.label: HousingSecurity
children.description: Whether the subject is at-risk of losing their housing or in a stable housing situation

children.label: IncomeSource
children.description: Where the household income comes from

children.label: IncomeStability
children.description: Whether the subject regards his or her source of income as dependable

children.label: NonCashBenefit
children.description: Government benefits received by the focal subject, other than cash benefits

children.label: NumberOfDependents
children.description: The number of dependents supported by the subject

children.label: PerceivedEmotionalSafety
children.description: How often the subject feels physically safe in the subject's home environment

children.label: PerceivedPhysicalSafety
children.description: How often the subject feels physically safe in the subject's home environment

children.label: TransportationAvailability
children.description: Whether the subject has reliable transportation to bring him or her to medical appointments and to get medications

children.label: Travel
children.description: Trip to a foreign country or an area, particularly when a health risk is involved

children.label: shr.familyhistory
children.description: The SHR Family History domain contains definitions related to the life, health, and genetics of persons related to the person of record.

children.label: shr.immunization
children.description: The SHR Immunization domain contains definitions related to vaccinations, whether they are received, recommended, missing, or refused.

children.label: AgeOfSubjectAtTimeOfEvent
children.description: The age of the subject at a specific time when an event happened

children.label: ImmunizationAdministered
children.description: Represents an immunization that was administered to the subject

children.label: ImmunizationNotAdministeredReason
children.description: Reason the scheduled or intended immunization was not given, e.g., refused, no supply, patient didn't show up.

children.label: ImmunizationRefused
children.description: Represents an immunization that was offered but declined by the subject or the subject's guardian

children.label: ImmunizationStatement
children.description: A statement relating to a vaccination that was or was not administered to the subject.

children.label: LotNumber
children.description: A distinctive alpha-numeric identification code assigned by the manufacturer or distributor to a specific quantity of manufactured material or product within a batch.

children.label: TargetDateRange
children.description: Dates between which when a future event should occur

children.label: Vaccine
children.description: A specific type or manufactured instance of a vaccine, a prophylactic or therapeutic preparation given to produce immune response to pathogenic organisms or substances.

children.label: VaccineManufacturer
children.description: The organization that produces the vaccine

children.label: WasNotGiven
children.description: Indicates a medication or substance was not given or administered.

children.label: shr.lab
children.description: The SHR Lab domain contains definitions for elements related to laboratory measurements.

children.label: HIVScreeningTestRequest
children.description: A request for a rapid HIV screening test

children.label: HIVScreeningTestResult
children.description: The result of an HIV Screening Test

children.label: HIVSupplementalTestResult
children.description: The result of a supplement HIV test, following up an initial screening

children.label: PatientInstructions
children.description: Information for the patient, such as, where to get the test, how to prepare for the test, etc.

children.label: PerformerInstructions
children.description: Information for the performer of the test, if needed.

children.label: PriorityOfRequest
children.description: Urgency level for which results must be reported to the requestor or responsible individual

children.label: Qualifier
children.description: A description of the conditions or context of a test, for example, under sedation, fasting or post-exercise. Body position and body site are also qualifiers, but handled separately. A qualifier cannot modify the measurement type; for example, a fasting blood sugar is still a blood sugar.

children.label: ReasonForRequest
children.description: The justification for this order, which may be because the subject is at risk for a disease, as part of a diagnostic process, due to a symptom or problem, a part of a care plan, or periodic monitoring

children.label: RequestedPerformer
children.description: Who should carry out the tests. For example, the patient or caregiver

children.label: RequestedPerformerType
children.description: What type of actor should carry out the testing

children.label: RequestStatus
children.description: The extent to which the ordering process has progressed, for this order.

children.label: SpecimenType
children.description: Kind of material that forms the specimen

children.label: TestCode
children.description: The code for a laboratory, radiologic, and other clinical test or measurement that helps to determine the presence, absence, or degree of a condition, or assess the health of an individual.

children.label: TestMethod
children.description: The technique used to carry out a procedure, if not implicit in the test code

children.label: TestRequest
children.description: A record of a request for a diagnostic investigation service to be performed. The requested test can be any laboratory, radiologic, or other clinical test or measurement used to determine the presence, absence, or degree of a condition, or assess the function or health of an individual. This includes patient-generated data, such as pedometer readings.

children.label: TestTiming
children.description: When test or tests should be done. If the tests are a series or recur (e.g. daily blood sugar testing in the morning) then a Timing can be used to describe the periodicity.

children.label: shr.lifehistory
children.description: The SHR Lifehistory domain contains definitions related to the course of events in the life of the person of record that might impact health, health risks, or future treatment.

children.label: CongenitalAbnormalities
children.description: Any abnormality, genetic, anatomical, biochemical, evident at birth or during the neonatal period. Includes malformations, deformations, and chromosomal abnormalities

children.label: EducationalAttainment
children.description: Educational attainment or level of education of individuals.

children.label: Employer
children.description: A person or entity which hires the services of another.

children.label: Employment
children.description: Engagement in an activity or service for profit, wages, salary, or as a service to others.

children.label: EmploymentStatus
children.description: Condition of employment including full- or part-time, temporary or permanent, and unemployment.

children.label: MilitaryBranch
children.description: The branch of the US military that the subject has served

children.label: MilitaryService
children.description: History of service in the US military

children.label: MilitaryServiceDischargeStatus
children.description: How the subject was formally discharged from the US Military

children.label: MilitaryServiceEra
children.description: The time period of US military service.

children.label: MilitaryStatus
children.description: The current connection to the US military

children.label: Occupation
children.description: The principal activity that a person does to earn money, specifying the job performed by the subject, tor example, accountant, programmer analyst, patient care associate, staff nurse, etc.

children.label: PrenatalExposure
children.description: Fetal contact with a dangerous substance via the mother.

children.label: ServiceConnectedDisability
children.description: Percentage disability resulting from US Military Service

children.label: shr.medication
children.description: The SHR Medication domain contains definitions related to medications taken, or not taken, by the person of record, both currently and in the past.

children.label: ActiveIngredientAmount
children.description: The amount of an active ingredient in a medication

children.label: AdditionalDoseInstruction
children.description: Supplemental instructions - e.g. 'with meals'

children.label: Adherence
children.description: A statement of the ability and cooperation of the patient in taking medicine or supplement as recommended or prescribed. This includes correct timing, dosage, and frequency.

children.label: AdherenceLevel
children.description: The frequency that the stated treatment plan, prescription, or protocol is followed.

children.label: AdministrationBodySite
children.description: The anatomic site at which medical intervention is applied.

children.label: AdministrationMethod
children.description: Technique for administering medication

children.label: AmountOfMedication
children.description: A standardized measure or discrete amount of medication serving as a reference for dosing or strength, for example, 1 tablet.

children.label: AmountPerDose
children.description: The amount of medication taken at each dose, as a quantity or range

children.label: BrandName
children.description: The brand name of a product

children.label: Dosage
children.description: The dosage of the medication as prescribed

children.label: DoseAsNeededIndicator
children.description: Indicates that a drug or therapy should be used as often as the patient decides it is necessary.

children.label: DoseForm
children.description: The form in which active and/or inert ingredient(s) are physically presented

children.label: DoseInstructionsText
children.description: The directions (signetur) on the drug prescription or dispensing record.

children.label: MaximumDosePerTimePeriod
children.description: The maximum amount of a medication to be taken in a given period of time.

children.label: Medication
children.description: A type of prescription drug or over-the-counter drug that is used to prevent, treat, or relieve symptoms of a disease or abnormal condition, but excluding vaccines.

children.label: MedicationAfterChange
children.description: A medication taken, after the change

children.label: MedicationBeforeChange
children.description: The medication taken, prior to the change

children.label: MedicationChange
children.description: Description of a modification or change of a medication or dosage.

children.label: MedicationNotAdministered
children.description: A record of a medication NOT administered. Recorded when deviating from the care plan.

children.label: MedicationNotPrescribed
children.description: A record of a medication NOT prescribed. Recorded only when deviating from the normal expectation, care plan, or standard of care.

children.label: MedicationPrescribed
children.description: Report of a medication prescription.

children.label: MedicationStatement
children.description: Report of a medication used or not used. Medication use is either reported, directly observed, or inferred from clinical events associated with orders, prescriptions written, pharmacy dispensings, procedural administrations, and other patient-reported information.

children.label: MedicationStrength
children.description: Specifies how many (or how much) of the active ingredient there is in this Medication, to be interpreted as a ratio. For example, 250 mg per tablet. This is expressed as a ratio where the numerator is 250mg and the denominator is 1 tablet.

children.label: NonAdherenceReason
children.description: Reason for not following the stated treatment plan, prescription, or protocol.

children.label: ReasonForUse
children.description: The rationale for why the patient receives a medication or prescription

children.label: ReasonMedicationNotGiven
children.description: The rationale for NOT using particular medication treatment

children.label: RouteIntoBody
children.description: The way a substance enters an organism after contact, particularly, the route of drug administration.

children.label: TimingOfDoses
children.description: When doses of medication should be administered

children.label: TypeOfChange
children.description: Whether the change is a dose change, switch to a new medication, or discontinuation

children.label: UsedOrNotUsed
children.description: Whether the medication stated was used or not used

children.label: shr.observation
children.description: The SHR Observation domain contains basic definitions used to capture information about measurements, lab tests, and assessments.

children.label: AssessmentTool
children.description: The name of the formal assessment or screening tool used to assess the behavior

children.label: BehavioralHistory
children.description: A statement about observable responses, actions, or activities of the subject. Can be used to assert or deny behaviors.

children.label: ChangeFlag
children.description: Indicator of significant change (delta) from the last or previous measurement.

children.label: ClinicallyRelevantTime
children.description: The time or time period that the observation addresses. The clinically relevant time is not necessarily when the information is gathered.

children.label: DidBehaviorOccur
children.description: The likelihood the behavior happened. If missing, it is assumed the exposure did occur.

children.label: DidExposureOccur
children.description: The likelihood the exposure happened, e.g. exposed to asbestos in his workplace (using Setting). If missing, it is assumed the exposure did occur.

children.label: ExposureMethod
children.description: How the exposure occurred, e.g. injection, ingestion, sexual contact, inhalation, cutaneous contact.

children.label: ExposureToSubstanceStatement
children.description: A statement about exposure to a substance, type of substance, or disease vector potentially affecting health, including pollutants, blood products, pets, recreational drugs, sexual transmitted diseases, foods, toxins, pathogens, or prenatal exposures to teratogens. Can be used to assert or deny such exposures.

children.label: HistoryObservation
children.description: Captures some aspect of the life, health, or medical history of a subject.

children.label: Interpretation
children.description: A clinical interpretation of a measurement

children.label: Observation
children.description: A statement about an act that is intended to result in new information about a subject. The focus of an observation can include the subject's behavior, physiological state, functional status, environment, exposures to substances, etc. The method of observing can be via questions, assessment, laboratory test, or imaging procedure.

children.label: ObservationCategory
children.description: A categorization of the observation according to how the observation was collected or its clinical area.

children.label: ObservationCode
children.description: A term from a controlled vocabulary that defines the data element (the question, not the answer) as specifically as possible. The specific code should always align with the concept of the element, but may be more specific. For example, the concept associated with medications is code for 'medication used', but the ObservationCode is the code for the particular medication used. For tests, ObservationCode identifies the specific test being performed, and for observations, the specific question being asked.

children.label: ObservationNotMade
children.description: Whether the observation described by the specific concept code was not made (or not ordered). This is the equivalent of 'not asked'. Particularly important if an observation or test is normally ordered, but was not ordered in a particular instance. This is distinct from a missing value, in which the observation was attempted (the question asked), but the value normally resulting from the observation was not obtained (question not answered).

children.label: ObservationNotMadeReason
children.description: An explanation of why the observation was not made (or ordered), i.e., why the question was not asked.

children.label: ObservationStatus
children.description: Qualifier describing the stage or administrative state of the observation. If not given, it is assumed the status is final.

children.label: ReadinessToChange
children.description: How motivated the subject is to change the behavior, if the behavior is ongoing, and change would be beneficial.

children.label: ReferenceRange
children.description: The usual or acceptable range for a test result

children.label: SocialHistory
children.description: The external elements and conditions which surround, influence, and affect the life and development of the subject. Includes social conditions such as poverty, violence, bullying.

children.label: SourceOrVector
children.description: Where the substance originated. Vectors include animals (e.g., tick, mosquito, cats, livestock) capable of transmitting an infectious agent among vertebrates. Sources could include food, contaminated drinking water, air, radon gas in the home, etc.

children.label: TestResult
children.description: The result of a laboratory, radiologic, or other clinical test or measurement performed to determine the presence, absence, or degree of a condition or assess the health of an individual.

children.label: TestTime
children.description: The clincally-relevant time or time period at which a measurement was taken or specimen collected. Use a period if the measurement or specimen collection continued over a significant period of time (e.g. 24 hour Urine Sodium).

children.label: shr.problem
children.description: The SHR Problem domain contains basic definitions used to capture information about problems, concerns, complaints, and disorders.

children.label: Abatement
children.description: The end, remission or resolution.

children.label: AcademicProblem
children.description: A problem with learning or behavior in a learning environment

children.label: Asplenia
children.description: Congenital absence of spleen.

children.label: ClinicalStatus
children.description: A flag indicating whether the problem is active or inactive, recurring, in remission, or resolved.

children.label: Criticality
children.description: A clinical judgment of potential clinical harm, or seriousness, of a condition. When the worst case result is assessed to have a life-threatening or organ system threatening potential, it is considered to be of high criticality.

children.label: GradeOrStage
children.description: The stage or grade of a disease.

children.label: IncludeOnProblemList
children.description: Whether or not to include this problem on the subject's current problem list.

children.label: Injury
children.description: Damage inflicted on the body by an external force.

children.label: LikelihoodThisProblemExists
children.description: Whether this problem exists in the patient. If this element is absent, it is assumed the problem exists.

children.label: Manifestation
children.description: A complaint or observed (subjective) indication that a person has a condition or disease. Some examples of symptoms are headache, fever, fatigue, nausea, vomiting, and pain.

children.label: MentalHealthProblem
children.description: A problem relating to a person’s psychological and emotional well-being

children.label: Onset
children.description: The beginning or first appearance of a mental or physical disorder.

children.label: ProblemCategory
children.description: A categorization of the problem using common clinical categories.

children.label: ProblemCode
children.description: A problem (symptom, disorder, abnormality, condition, etc.).

children.label: ProblemStatement
children.description: A statement about a disorder, abnormality, problem, injury, complaint, functionality, concern, illness, disease, ailment, sickness, affliction, upset, difficulty, disorder, symptom, or trouble. May be used to state the existence or non-existence of a problem.

children.label: Severity
children.description: Degree of severity of a symptom, disorder, or problem.

children.label: SupportingEvidenceQuality
children.description: An assessment of the quality and/or quantity of the source information that supports judgment.

children.label: WhenClinicallyRecognized
children.description: The time at which a condition or problem was first identified in a healthcare context

children.label: shr.sex
children.description: The SHR Sex domain contains definitions related to the sexual health and behavior of the person of record.

children.label: ContraceptiveMethodRecommendation
children.description: The contraceptive method(s) recommended or prescribed by a provider, after counseling and assessment. More than one method can be selected, if applicable.

children.label: ContraceptiveMethodsUsed
children.description: The method or methods of contraception used

children.label: CurrentPregnancyStatus
children.description: Whether or not the subject is currently pregnant

children.label: DifficultyWithIntercourse
children.description: Problem with sexual intercourse

children.label: Dispensed
children.description: Whether an item, such as a medication or device, was given to a subject.

children.label: GenderIdentity
children.description: Subjective personal perception of one's own gender, which can be male, female, a blend of both, or neither.

children.label: NumberOfLivingChildren
children.description: Number of living children

children.label: NumberOfPreviousPregnancies
children.description: Number of previous pregnancies

children.label: NumberOfSexualPartnersPastYear
children.description: Number of sexual partners in past year

children.label: PregnancyHistory
children.description: Information about current and past pregnancies

children.label: PregnancyIntention
children.description: Whether the subject or his/her partner has a plan or desire to either become pregnant or have a child in the next year/near future.

children.label: ReasonForNotRecommendingContraceptive
children.description: If not using a method of contraception, why

children.label: ReasonForNotUsingContraceptive
children.description: If not using a method of contraception, why

children.label: SexualActivity
children.description: Characterization of the sexual activity of the subject

children.label: SexualBehavior
children.description: Experience with sexual intercourse

children.label: SexualIdentity
children.description: Information on gender identity and sexual orientation

children.label: SexualOrientation
children.description: An inherent and enduring emotional, romantic or sexual attraction to other people.

children.label: shr.vital
children.description: The SHR Vital domain contains definitions for basic physiological measurements categorized as vital signs.

children.label: BloodPressure
children.description: The force of circulating blood on the walls of the arteries.

children.label: BodyHeight
children.description: The distance from the sole to the crown of the head

children.label: BodyLength
children.description: The distance from the sole to the crown of the head, lying down (typically 0-2 years).

children.label: BodyMassIndex
children.description: A general indicator of the body fat an individual is carrying based upon the ratio of weight to height.

children.label: BodyTemperature
children.description: The measure of the level of heat in a human or animal.

children.label: BodyWeight
children.description: The mass or quantity of heaviness of an individual. Does not include estimates of fetal bodyweight.

children.label: DiastolicPressure
children.description: The blood pressure after the contraction of the heart while the chambers of the heart refill with blood, when the pressure is lowest

children.label: HeadCircumference
children.description: Circumference of the head (typically 0-2 years)

children.label: HeadTiltAngle
children.description: The angle at which the head is tilted relative to a level position while physiologic TestResults are taken

children.label: HeartRate
children.description: The number of times the HEART VENTRICLES contract per unit of time, usually per minute.

children.label: OxygenSaturation
children.description: Oxygen saturation in Arterial blood by Pulse oximetry

children.label: RespiratoryRate
children.description: The rate of breathing (inhalation and exhalation) measured within in a unit time, expressed as breaths per minute.

children.label: SystolicPressure
children.description: The blood pressure during the contraction of the left ventricle of the heart, when blood pressure is at its highest
